div.marquee: As per Gov. Murphy, Remote/Virtual Learning will continue until further notice. He will provide an update on May 15th.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-9dout6l elementor-section-stretched elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

p.span: Information

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-20df7ad elementor-align-left elementor-icon-list--layout-traditional elementor-widget elementor-widget-icon-list

p.span: Dear Academy Charter Family,

Governor Murphy has ordered all schools to remain closed until further notice. He will provide an update on May 15th. We are required to stay closed under this mandate and will continue with our Remote/Virtual Learning. Here are two adjustments to our learning plan.
We have modified the grading scale for Remote/Virtual Learning to focus on ‘completion.’ The quality of a student’s work can improve their grade.
To earn a 93 or ‘A’: Complete 95-100% of your assignments for each class
To earn an 85 or ‘B’: Complete 80-94% of your assignments
To earn a 77 or ‘C’: Complete 65-79% of your assignments
To earn a 70 or ‘D’: Complete 50-64% of your assignments
Monday: Block 1 from 9am-12pm
Tuesday: Block 2 from 9am-12 pm
Wednesday: Block 4 from 9am-12pm; Electives from 1pm-3pm
Thursday: Block 5 from 9am-12pm
Teachers are available from 1pm-3pm daily and Friday mornings to assist students.
Students must continue to log into their classes for attendance tracking, complete assignments, and be active learners. Stay positive and work hard

li.span: Wash your hands regularly with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
Keep your hands away from your mouth, eyes, and nose.
Contact your health care provider immediately if you experience any symptoms.

p.span: Stay Safe. Be Well. Live Your Dream.
Shawn Heeter
Lead Person/Dean of Students
Academy Charter High School

strong.span: Food distribution schedule is as follows:

div.a: Free Wifi Access For Chromebooks Information

span.span: Block 1 meet via Google Classroom/Meet from 9am to 12pm
Block 2 meet via Google Classroom/Meet from 9am to 12pm
Block 4 meet via Google Classroom/Meet from 9am to 12pm
Block 5 meet via Google Classroom/Meet from 9am to 12pm

li.span: Fridays: Login to finish any assignments for the week.
Staff accessible daily, Monday through Thursday from 1-3pm through Google Hangouts, Classroom, and email.

p.a: Click here for Academy Charter High School Letter regarding COVID 19

div.span: As a child-centered school, Academy Charter High School is dedicated to providing a challenging, nurturing environment in which each child’s social and academic potential is maximized. The students who graduate from ACHS will have the self-esteem, self-discipline, intellectual curiosity and critical thinking skills to maintain their status as lifelong learners.

p.span: Please Click Here to view Academy Charter High School’s state testing letter to parents.
The school calendar for the upcoming year is now on our site!

Academy Charter High School has partnered with the High School Esports League and brought competitive online gaming to our school. There are 4 seasons; fall, holiday, winter, and spring in which our teams will compete against other high schools across the nation. For more information about the program visit http://www.highschoolesportsleague.com/
Academy Charter High School currently has a student with a severe

airborne allergy to cinnamon. It is vital that there is a strict avoidance to this substance in order to prevent a life-threatening allergic reaction. In order to provide a safe school environment, cinnamon or products containing cinnamon are prohibited from being in the school building
Please fill out our parent survey here
Your responses are much appreciated and help us out a lot!

p.span: In the 2017-2018 school year, our school conscientiously implemented the requirements found in the anti-bullying bill of rights act.
